author: SwarfegaGit
body:
I often use Restart-Computer to restart two or more computers along with the Wait parameter so I know when they are back online.  Sometimes I will get one or more computer fail to respond after the reboot.  Unfortunately the progress bar just show a count of the number of computers that are complete.  It then hangs waiting for the non-responding computers to respond without giving any indication as to which one that is.

Restart-Service has a nice warning message that it's waiting for a service to stop/start.  This would be ideal here but that could be quite spammy if it was doing that for every computer being restarted.

Steps to reproduce
------------------

```powershell
Restart-Computer -ComputerName COMPUTER01, COMPUTER02 -Wait -Verbose
```

Expected behavior
-----------------

```none
Give some indication as to which computer it is waiting for
```

Actual behavior
---------------

![Restart-Computer](https://i.imgur.com/fWmXrYZ.png)

Environment data
----------------

<!-- provide the output of $PSVersionTable -->

```powershell

----                           -----

PSEdition                      Core

Platform                       Win32NT
PSCompatibleVersions           {1.0, 2.0, 3.0, 4.0...}

```
title: Make Restart-Computer -Wait more verbose
